sn2.16:1: Standing to one side, the young deva Vasudatta recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn2.16:2: v.301"As if smitten by a sword,As if his head were on fire,A bhikkhu should wander mindfullyTo abandon sensual lust."
sn2.16:3: v.02"As if smitten by a sword,As if his head were on fire,A bhikkhu should wander mindfullyTo abandon identity view."
